& so weightlifting @ firehouse gym makes me think of DOMS which makes me think of Peace Corps & painful reactions to vaccination which reminds me of my father & his vaccinations upon joining the U.S. Army at age 16 during WW2, & how my father got me into being a firefighter. End.
I've tweeted before how I've inherited from my father my name, firefighting, a fondness for beer, and this beer mug: https://t.co/KNwIKQnP0q

My father was inducted into U.S. Army Air Corps in April, 1945, 18 years old, the day after his graduation from high school(!). There was a further surprise in his Honorable Discharge papers. He had "pre-enlisted" at age 16 & received vaccinations at ages 16 & 17. 10/

Dad didn't talk about his time in the service except for stories about being brave enough to shave with a dull razor & no soap to pass inspection & similar. In my mind he had become a Liberator bombardier-navigator but his discharge papers showed that he was an aircraft welder 9/

I had known that my father was in the U.S. Army Air Corps during WW2, and that he had not served overseas but had received orders to ship out to the Pacific Theatre just before the war ended & the orders were rescinded. 8/

But if you stick to safe & legal supplements & push yourself hard (as I do) you're gonna get at least a taste of it. Anyway as I began writing this thread I found myself thinking about something I discovered about my father, RIP 2013, when researching his obituary. 7/

There's no vaccine for DOMS, but it can mitigated somewhat. DOMS is a well understood phenomenon having to do with lactic acid & muscular physiology & etc. Post-workout supplements from reputable providers contain ingredients that help your muscles recover with less DOMS. 6/

They weren't kidding. Man, that next day was killer. But hey: GOD BLESS VACCINES AND THE BRAVE & NOBLE SOULS WHO HAVE BEQUEATHED THEM TO US! LET US HAVE MORE VACCINES, SOONER. And may the deluded anti-vaxxers of the world somehow have the scales removed from their eyes, amen. 5/

Yellow Fever, Diptheria, weird-ass-disease-you've-never-heard-of, Typhoid, Typhus. They saved the kicker for last. It was one of the "T" diseases, & the vaccine was a live attenuated virus. "Go to your hotel room, take some aspirin & go to bed. See you 2 days from now." 4/
Makes me think of when I reported for duty, as it were, as Peace Corps Volunteer in 1974. 1 week in Washington DC for immersion in Peace Corps theory & practice, plus a shit-ton of vaccinations. 3/

I work out with weights regularly, but I can tell when I've hit muscles in a new way or recruited slacker muscles that I've missed in other routines. I hit a bunch of slackers tonight. There's gonna be DOMS for sure (delayed-onset muscle soreness) 24-48 hours from now. 2/

At firehouse weight room tonight I did a 10-exercise full-body workout in 5 x 5 format. (Five sets in a row with short rest between sets, with 5 repetitions in each set). 1hr 17 minutes. I may live to regret this. 1/
